unnormalised: The Indian Institute of Science (IISc) Bangalore has announced a groundbreaking initiative to promote the adoption of LaTeX in STEM education across the country. The initiative, slated to begin in early 2025, aims to equip students and researchers with the necessary skills to produce high-quality, typeset documents for academic and professional purposes. A series of workshops are planned, commencing on 15/03/2025, targeting institutions in both urban and rural areas.
normalised: The Indian Institute of Science (I-I-S-c) Bangalore has announced a groundbreaking initiative to promote the adoption of L-a-T-e-X in S-T-E-M education across the country. The initiative, slated to begin in early two thousand and twenty five, aims to equip students and researchers with the necessary skills to produce high-quality, typeset documents for academic and professional purposes. A series of workshops are planned, commencing on fifteenth March two thousand and twenty five, targeting institutions in both urban and rural areas.

unnormalised: The program will cover foundational aspects, including the use of basic mathematical symbols (e.g., $\alpha$, $\beta$, $\gamma$) and equation environments (e.g., $equation$, $align$). Advanced topics such as creating complex tables using the $tabular$ environment and formatting algorithms with the $algorithmic$ package will also be addressed. Furthermore, participants will learn to leverage packages like $tikz$ for generating publication-ready diagrams. The cost of the program is estimated to be Rs. 5000 per participant.

Advanced topics such as creating complex tables using the tabular environment and formatting algorithms with the algorithmic package will also be addressed. Furthermore, participants will learn to leverage packages like tikz for generating publication-ready diagrams. The cost of the program is estimated to be rupee five thousand per participant.

unnormalised: Dr. Meena Krishnan, the lead researcher spearheading this initiative, emphasized the importance of LaTeX proficiency in conveying complex mathematical and scientific concepts accurately. "LaTeX offers unparalleled control over document formatting, ensuring that equations and mathematical expressions are presented in a clear and standardized manner," she stated. The project anticipates training approx. 10000 individuals in its first phase.

unnormalised: Applications for the workshops are now open and can be submitted through the IISc website until 31/12/2024. Further details regarding the schedule, syllabus, and eligibility criteria can be found on the website. The workshops are expected to be held across multiple locations, including Delhi, Mumbai, and Chennai, making them accessible to a wider audience.
